when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Standard greeting during the day.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to apologize, get attention, or ask for a favor.
example: すみません、道を聞いてもいいですか？ (sumimasen, michi o kiitemo ii desu ka?) - Excuse me, may I ask for directions?

when_to_say: Affirmative response.
example: はい、そうです。(hai, sou desu.) - Yes, that's right.

when_to_say: Negative response.
example: いいえ、違います。(iie, chigaimasu.) - No, that's wrong.

when_to_say: Used when parting ways in the evening or before going to bed.
example: おやすみなさい、また明日！ (oyasuminasai, mata ashita!) - Good night, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Said before eating a meal.
example: いただきます！ (itadakimasu!) - Let's eat!

when_to_say: Said after finishing a meal.
example: ごちそうさまでした！ (gochisousama deshita!) - Thank you for the delicious meal!

when_to_say: General farewell.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう。(sayounara, mata aimashou.) - Goodbye, let's meet again.

when_to_say: Used when making a request or asking for a favor.
example: これをお願いします。(kore o onegaishimasu.) - Please, I'll have this.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of consuming food.
example: ご飯を食べる。(gohan o taberu.) - To eat rice.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of consuming beverages.
example: 水を飲む。(mizu o nomu.) - To drink water.

when_to_say: Used to describe movement to a place.
example: 学校に行く。(gakkou ni iku.) - To go to school.

when_to_say: Used to describe movement towards the speaker.
example: 家に帰る。(ie ni kaeru.) - To come home.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of perceiving with eyes.
example: 映画を見る。(eiga o miru.) - To watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used for hearing sounds or asking questions.
example: 音楽を聞く。(ongaku o kiku.) - To listen to music.

when_to_say: Used for verbal communication.
example: 日本語を話す。(nihongo o hanasu.) - To speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used for understanding written text.
example: 本を読む。(hon o yomu.) - To read a book.

when_to_say: Used for producing written content.
example: 手紙を書く。(tegami o kaku.) - To write a letter.

when_to_say: Used for purchasing items.
example: 服を買う。(fuku o kau.) - To buy clothes.

when_to_say: Used to refer to someone who studies.
example: 彼は大学生です。(kare wa daigakusei desu.) - He is a university student.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a teacher or master.
example: 田中先生は優しいです。(Tanaka sensei wa yasashii desu.) - Mr. Tanaka is kind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a medical professional.
example: 彼女は医者になりたい。(kanojo wa isha ni naritai.) - She wants to become a doctor.

when_to_say: Used to refer to someone working for a company.
example: 私の父は会社員です。(watashi no chichi wa kaishain desu.) - My father is a company employee.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a written or printed work.
example: 面白い本を読んだ。(omoshiroi hon o yonda.) - I read an interesting book.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a writing instrument.
example: ペンを貸してください。(pen o kashite kudasai.) - Please lend me a pen.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a piece of furniture for working or studying.
example: 机の上に本がある。(tsukue no ue ni hon ga aru.) - There is a book on the desk.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a seat with a back.
example: 椅子に座ってください。(isu ni suwatte kudasai.) - Please sit on the chair.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a container for carrying items.
example: カバンの中に何がありますか？(kaban no naka ni nani ga arimasu ka?) - What is in the bag?

when_to_say: Used to refer to a device for telling time.
example: 壁に時計がかかっている。(kabe ni tokei ga kakatte iru.) - A clock is hanging on the wall.

when_to_say: Refers to the current day.
example: 今日は晴れです。(kyou wa hare desu.) - It's sunny today.

when_to_say: Refers to the day after today.
example: 明日は休みです。(ashita wa yasumi desu.) - Tomorrow is a holiday.

when_to_say: Refers to the day before today.
example: 昨日は雨でした。(kinou wa ame deshita.) - It rained yesterday.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a period or point in time.
example: 時間は大切です。(jikan wa taisetsu desu.) - Time is important.

when_to_say: Refers to the period from dawn to noon.
example: 毎朝、早く起きます。(maiasa, hayaku okimasu.) - I wake up early every morning.

when_to_say: Refers to the middle of the day.
example: 昼ご飯を食べましょう。(hirugohan o tabemashou.) - Let's eat lunch.

when_to_say: Refers to the latter part of the day.
example: 晩ご飯は何ですか？(bangohan wa nan desu ka?) - What's for dinner?

when_to_say: Refers to a period of seven days.
example: 来週、旅行に行きます。(raishuu, ryokou ni ikimasu.) - I'm going on a trip next week.

when_to_say: Used for calendar months or the celestial body.
example: 今月は忙しいです。(kongetsu wa isogashii desu.) - I'm busy this month.

when_to_say: Used for a period of 12 months.
example: 来年、日本に行きたいです。(rainen, Nihon ni ikitai desu.) - I want to go to Japan next year.

when_to_say: Used for a train or bus station.
example: 駅はどこですか？(eki wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the station?

when_to_say: Used for a medical facility.
example: 病院に行かなければなりません。(byouin ni ikanakereba narimasen.) - I have to go to the hospital.

when_to_say: Used for a financial institution.
example: 銀行でお金を引き出す。(ginkou de okane o hikidasu.) - To withdraw money at the bank.

when_to_say: Used for mailing letters and packages.
example: 郵便局で切手を買う。(yuubinkyoku de kitte o kau.) - To buy stamps at the post office.

when_to_say: Used for borrowing books.
example: 図書館で勉強します。(toshokan de benkyou shimasu.) - I study at the library.

when_to_say: Used for buying groceries.
example: スーパーで買い物をする。(suupaa de kaimono o suru.) - To shop at the supermarket.

when_to_say: Used for eating out.
example: このレストランは美味しいです。(kono resutoran wa oishii desu.) - This restaurant is delicious.

when_to_say: Used for recreation outdoors.
example: 公園で散歩する。(kouen de sanpo suru.) - To take a walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used for one's residence.
example: 家に帰ります。(ie ni kaerimasu.) - I'm going home.

when_to_say: Used for a space within a building.
example: 私の部屋は広いです。(watashi no heya wa hiroi desu.) - My room is spacious.

when_to_say: Marks the subject of a sentence, especially with intransitive verbs or when introducing new information.
example: 猫がいます。(neko ga imasu.) - There is a cat.

when_to_say: Marks the direct object of a transitive verb.
example: 水を飲みます。(mizu o nomimasu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Indicates a specific location, destination, or time.
example: 学校に行きます。(gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Indicates where an action takes place or the means by which something is done.
example: 図書館で勉強します。(toshokan de benkyou shimasu.) - I study at the library.

when_to_say: Connects nouns (and) or indicates who one is with.
example: 友達と映画を見ました。(tomodachi to eiga o mimashita.) - I watched a movie with a friend.

when_to_say: Indicates origin (place or time) or reason.
example: 日本から来ました。(Nihon kara kimashita.) - I came from Japan.

when_to_say: Indicates a limit in time or space.
example: 東京まで行きます。(Toukyou made ikimasu.) - I'm going to Tokyo.

when_to_say: Used to seek agreement or confirm information.
example: このケーキ、美味しいですね。(kono keeki, oishii desu ne.) - This cake is delicious, isn't it?

when_to_say: Used to convey new information or emphasize a statement.
example: これは私の本ですよ。(kore wa watashi no hon desu yo.) - This is my book, you know.

when_to_say: Turns a statement into a question.
example: これは何ですか？(kore wa nan desu ka?) - What is this?

meaning: thank you for your hard work
when_to_say: Used to acknowledge someone's effort, common in workplaces.
example: 今日の仕事、お疲れ様でした。(kyou no shigoto, otsukaresama deshita.) - Thank you for your hard work today.

when_to_say: Very polite way to apologize or ask for a favor, often used in business.
example: 恐れ入りますが、もう一度お願いします。(osoreirimasu ga, mou ichido onegaishimasu.) - Excuse me, but could you please repeat that?

when_to_say: Highest level of apology, used in serious situations or formal business.
example: ご迷惑をおかけし、誠に申し訳ございません。(gomeiwaku o okake shi, makoto ni moushiwake gozaimasen.) - I am truly sorry for the inconvenience caused.

when_to_say: Humble form of 'miru' (to look), used when looking at something belonging to a superior.
example: 資料を拝見させていただきます。(shiryou o haiken sasete itadakimasu.) - I will humbly look at the documents.

when_to_say: Humble form of 'iku' (to go) or 'kuru' (to come), used when going/coming to a superior's place.
example: 明日、御社に参ります。(ashita, onsha ni mairimasu.) - I will humbly come to your company tomorrow.

when_to_say: Humble form of 'morau' (to receive), used when receiving something from a superior.
example: お土産を頂戴しました。(omiyage o choudai shimashita.) - I humbly received a souvenir.

when_to_say: Honorific form of 'iu' (to say), used when referring to a superior's words.
example: 社長がおっしゃいました。(shachou ga osshaimashita.) - The company president said.

when_to_say: Honorific form of 'miru' (to look), used when a superior looks at something.
example: 先生は新聞をご覧になります。(sensei wa shinbun o goran ni narimasu.) - The teacher reads the newspaper.

when_to_say: Honorific form of 'taberu' (to eat) or 'nomu' (to drink), used when a superior eats/drinks.
example: お客様はコーヒーを召し上がりますか？(okyakusama wa koohii o meshiagarimasu ka?) - Would the customer like to drink coffee?

when_to_say: Honorific form of 'suru' (to do), used when a superior does something.
example: 部長は何をなさいますか？(buchou wa nani o nasaimasu ka?) - What will the department head do?

when_to_say: Used in academic or intellectual discussions.
example: 彼は哲学を専攻している。(kare wa tetsugaku o senkou shite iru.) - He majors in philosophy.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an abstract idea.
example: 新しい概念を導入する。(atarashii gainen o donyuu suru.) - To introduce a new concept.

when_to_say: Used to describe an observable fact or event.
example: 自然現象を研究する。(shizen genshou o kenkyuu suru.) - To research natural phenomena.

when_to_say: Used to describe the arrangement of parts in a whole.
example: 建物の構造は複雑だ。(tatemono no kouzou wa fukuzatsu da.) - The building's structure is complex.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of understanding or being aware of something.
example: 問題の認識が重要だ。(mondai no ninshiki ga juuyou da.) - Recognition of the problem is important.

when_to_say: Used in discussions about moral principles.
example: 企業の倫理観が問われている。(kigyou no rinrikan ga towarete iru.) - The ethics of the company are being questioned.

when_to_say: Used to describe something applicable everywhere or to everyone.
example: これは普遍的な真理だ。(kore wa fuhenteki na shinri da.) - This is a universal truth.

when_to_say: Used to describe something existing but not yet developed or manifest.
example: 潜在的なリスクを評価する。(senzaiteki na risuku o hyouka suru.) - To evaluate potential risks.

when_to_say: Used to describe the fundamental nature of something.
example: 問題の本質を理解する。(mondai no honshitsu o rikai suru.) - To understand the essence of the problem.

when_to_say: Used in academic or formal contexts for deep thought or analysis.
example: この論文は深い考察に基づいている。(kono ronbun wa fukai kousatsu ni motozuite iru.) - This paper is based on deep consideration.

when_to_say: Indicates completion of an action, sometimes with regret or unintended consequence.
example: 宿題を忘れてしまった。(shukudai o wasurete shimatta.) - I accidentally forgot my homework.

meaning: to do in advance/to leave as is
when_to_say: Indicates performing an action in preparation or leaving something in a certain state.
example: 晩ご飯を作っておく。(bangohan o tsukutte oku.) - I'll make dinner in advance.

when_to_say: Attached to a verb stem to indicate ease of action.
example: この本は読みやすい。(kono hon wa yomiyasui.) - This book is easy to read.

when_to_say: Attached to a verb stem to indicate difficulty of action.
example: この字は書きにくい。(kono ji wa kakinikui.) - This character is difficult to write.

when_to_say: Indicates something just happened, or that one does nothing but something.
example: 彼はゲームばかりしている。(kare wa geemu bakari shite iru.) - He does nothing but play games.

meaning: it should be/it is expected that
when_to_say: Expresses expectation or certainty based on logical reasoning.
example: 彼はもう着いているはずだ。(kare wa mou tsuite iru hazu da.) - He should have arrived already.

when_to_say: Expresses a subjective impression or appearance.
example: 雨が降るようです。(ame ga furu you desu.) - It seems like it's going to rain.

when_to_say: Expresses a more objective or widely accepted impression.
example: 彼は日本人らしい。(kare wa Nihonjin rashii.) - He seems like a Japanese person (he acts like one).

when_to_say: Indicates two actions happening simultaneously or a concession.
example: 音楽を聞きながら勉強する。(ongaku o kikinagara benkyou suru.) - I study while listening to music.

when_to_say: Expresses a contrast or unexpected outcome.
example: 彼は病気なのに、学校に行った。(kare wa byouki na noni, gakkou ni itta.) - Even though he was sick, he went to school.

when_to_say: Used to ask about the time.
example: 今、何時ですか？(ima, nanji desu ka?) - What time is it now?

when_to_say: Used to ask about location.
example: トイレはどこですか？(toire wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the restroom?

when_to_say: Used to ask about a person.
example: あの人は誰ですか？(ano hito wa dare desu ka?) - Who is that person?

when_to_say: Used to ask about time.
example: 誕生日はいつですか？(tanjoubi wa itsu desu ka?) - When is your birthday?

when_to_say: Used to ask for a reason.
example: なぜ日本語を勉強していますか？(naze Nihongo o benkyou shite imasu ka?) - Why are you studying Japanese?

when_to_say: Used to ask about method or manner.
example: どうやってここに来ましたか？(dou yatte koko ni kimashita ka?) - How did you come here?

when_to_say: Used to ask about quantity or age.
example: リンゴはいくつありますか？(ringo wa ikutsu arimasu ka?) - How many apples are there?

when_to_say: Used to ask about the price of something.
example: これはいくらですか？(kore wa ikura desu ka?) - How much is this?

when_to_say: Used to ask about the type or nature of something.
example: どんな音楽が好きですか？(donna ongaku ga suki desu ka?) - What kind of music do you like?

when_to_say: Used to ask about a choice between two or a polite 'where'.
example: コーヒーと紅茶、どちらがいいですか？(koohii to koucha, dochira ga ii desu ka?) - Which would you prefer, coffee or tea?

when_to_say: Standard greeting in Chinese.
example: 你好，很高兴认识你！ (nǐ hǎo, hěn gāoxìng rènshi nǐ!) - Hello, nice to meet you!

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude.
example: 谢谢你的帮助！ (xièxie nǐ de bāngzhù!) - Thank you for your help!

when_to_say: Response to 'thank you'.
example: 不客气，这是我应该做的。(bù kèqi, zhè shì wǒ yīnggāi zuò de.) - You're welcome, it's my pleasure.

when_to_say: Used to apologize.
example: 对不起，我迟到了。(duìbuqǐ, wǒ chídào le.) - I'm sorry, I'm late.

when_to_say: Response to an apology or to indicate something is not important.
example: 没关系，下次注意就好了。(méi guānxi, xià cì zhùyì jiù hǎo le.) - It's okay, just be careful next time.

when_to_say: Standard farewell.
example: 再见，明天见！ (zàijiàn, míngtiān jiàn!) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used as an affirmative response or as the verb 'to be'.
example: 是的，我是学生。(shì de, wǒ shì xuéshēng.) - Yes, I am a student.

when_to_say: Used to negate verbs or adjectives.
example: 我不是老师。(wǒ bú shì lǎoshī.) - I am not a teacher.

when_to_say: Used to make a polite request.
example: 请坐。(qǐng zuò.) - Please sit down.

when_to_say: Used for consuming food.
example: 我想吃面条。(wǒ xiǎng chī miàntiáo.) - I want to eat noodles.

when_to_say: Used for consuming beverages.
example: 你喜欢喝茶吗？(nǐ xǐhuān hē chá ma?) - Do you like to drink tea?

when_to_say: Used for movement to a location.
example: 我们去北京。(wǒmen qù Běijīng.) - We go to Beijing.

when_to_say: Used for movement towards the speaker.
example: 你什么时候来？(nǐ shénme shíhou lái?) - When are you coming?

when_to_say: Used for visual perception.
example: 我喜欢看电影。(wǒ xǐhuān kàn diànyǐng.) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used for auditory perception.
example: 我喜欢听音乐。(wǒ xǐhuān tīng yīnyuè.) - I like listening to music.

when_to_say: Used for verbal expression.
example: 你会说汉语吗？(nǐ huì shuō Hànyǔ ma?) - Can you speak Chinese?

when_to_say: Used for comprehending written material.
example: 我喜欢读书。(wǒ xǐhuān dú shū.) - I like reading books.

when_to_say: Used for putting words on paper or screen.
example: 请写下你的名字。(qǐng xiě xià nǐ de míngzì.) - Please write down your name.

when_to_say: Used for acquiring something in exchange for money.
example: 我想买一件新衣服。(wǒ xiǎng mǎi yī jiàn xīn yīfu.) - I want to buy a new piece of clothing.

when_to_say: Used for giving something in exchange for money.
example: 他们在卖什么？(tāmen zài mài shénme?) - What are they selling?

when_to_say: Used to refer to someone who studies.
example: 他是一个好学生。(tā shì yī ge hǎo xuéshēng.) - He is a good student.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a teacher.
example: 我的老师很友好。(wǒ de lǎoshī hěn yǒuhǎo.) - My teacher is very friendly.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a medical practitioner.
example: 她想成为一名医生。(tā xiǎng chéngwéi yī míng yīshēng.) - She wants to become a doctor.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an acquaintance.
example: 我有很多朋友。(wǒ yǒu hěn duō péngyou.) - I have many friends.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a written work.
example: 这本书很有趣。(zhè běn shū hěn yǒuqù.) - This book is very interesting.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a writing tool.
example: 请给我一支笔。(qǐng gěi wǒ yī zhī bǐ.) - Please give me a pen.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a piece of furniture.
example: 桌子上有一本书。(zhuōzi shàng yǒu yī běn shū.) - There is a book on the table.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a seat.
example: 请坐到椅子上。(qǐng zuò dào yǐzi shàng.) - Please sit on the chair.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a container.
example: 我的包很重。(wǒ de bāo hěn zhòng.) - My bag is heavy.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a cell phone.
example: 我新买了一个手机。(wǒ xīn mǎi le yī ge shǒujī.) - I bought a new mobile phone.

when_to_say: Refers to the current day.
example: 今天天气很好。(jīntiān tiānqì hěn hǎo.) - The weather is good today.

when_to_say: Refers to the day after today.
example: 明天我们去哪里？(míngtiān wǒmen qù nǎlǐ?) - Where are we going tomorrow?

when_to_say: Refers to the day before today.
example: 昨天我没去上班。(zuótiān wǒ méi qù shàngbān.) - I didn't go to work yesterday.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a period or point in time.
example: 你有时间吗？(nǐ yǒu shíjiān ma?) - Do you have time?

when_to_say: Refers to the period from dawn to noon.
example: 我早上七点起床。(wǒ zǎoshang qī diǎn qǐchuáng.) - I wake up at 7 AM.

when_to_say: Refers to midday.
example: 我们中午吃饭。(wǒmen zhōngwǔ chīfàn.) - We eat lunch at noon.

when_to_say: Refers to the period from evening to night.
example: 我晚上看电视。(wǒ wǎnshang kàn diànshì.) - I watch TV in the evening.

when_to_say: Refers to a period of seven days.
example: 这个星期我很忙。(zhè ge xīngqī wǒ hěn máng.) - I am very busy this week.

when_to_say: Used for calendar months or the celestial body.
example: 下个月是我的生日。(xià ge yuè shì wǒ de shēngrì.) - Next month is my birthday.

when_to_say: Used for a period of 12 months.
example: 明年我会去中国。(míngnián wǒ huì qù Zhōngguó.) - I will go to China next year.

when_to_say: Used for a place where trains stop.
example: 火车站离这里很近。(huǒchēzhàn lí zhèlǐ hěn jìn.) - The train station is very close to here.

when_to_say: Used for a medical facility.
example: 我需要去医院看医生。(wǒ xūyào qù yīyuàn kàn yīshēng.) - I need to go to the hospital to see a doctor.

when_to_say: Used for a financial institution.
example: 银行几点关门？(yínháng jǐ diǎn guānmén?) - What time does the bank close?

when_to_say: Used for sending mail.
example: 我要去邮局寄信。(wǒ yào qù yóujú jì xìn.) - I need to go to the post office to mail a letter.

when_to_say: Used for reading or borrowing books.
example: 图书馆里很安静。(túshūguǎn lǐ hěn ānjìng.) - It's very quiet in the library.

when_to_say: Used for buying groceries.
example: 我们去超市买菜吧。(wǒmen qù chāoshì mǎi cài ba.) - Let's go to the supermarket to buy groceries.

when_to_say: Used for dining out or staying overnight.
example: 这家饭店的菜很好吃。(zhè jiā fàndiàn de cài hěn hǎochī.) - The food at this restaurant is delicious.

when_to_say: Used for outdoor recreation.
example: 周末我们去公园散步。(zhōumò wǒmen qù gōngyuán sànbù.) - We go for a walk in the park on weekends.

when_to_say: Used for one's residence or family members.
example: 我回家了。(wǒ huí jiā le.) - I'm home.

when_to_say: Used for a space within a building.
example: 我的房间很干净。(wǒ de fángjiān hěn gānjìng.) - My room is very clean.

when_to_say: Used in 'ba' constructions to place the object before the verb, emphasizing the result.
example: 请把门关上。(qǐng bǎ mén guānshang.) - Please close the door.

when_to_say: Used to form passive voice sentences.
example: 他被狗咬了。(tā bèi gǒu yǎo le.) - He was bitten by a dog.

when_to_say: Emphasizes an extreme case or unexpected situation.
example: 他连饭都没吃。(tā lián fàn dōu méi chī.) - He didn't even eat food.

when_to_say: Indicates the beginning of an action or an impression.
example: 他看起来很累。(tā kàn qǐlai hěn lèi.) - He looks very tired.

when_to_say: Indicates continuation of an action.
example: 请继续说下去。(qǐng jìxù shuō xiàqù.) - Please continue speaking.

when_to_say: Used to introduce an exception or additional items.
example: 除了他以外，所有人都来了。(chúle tā yǐwài, suǒyǒu rén dōu lái le.) - Besides him, everyone else came.

when_to_say: Expresses that a result remains true regardless of conditions.
example: 无论多忙，我都会去。(wúlùn duō máng, wǒ dōu huì qù.) - No matter how busy I am, I will go.

when_to_say: Used to suggest a better alternative.
example: 与其抱怨，不如行动。(yǔqí bàoyuàn, bùrú xíngdòng.) - Rather than complaining, it's better to act.

when_to_say: Used to explain the reason for something.
example: 他之所以成功，是因为他很努力。(tā zhīsuǒyǐ chénggōng, shì yīnwèi tā hěn nǔlì.) - The reason why he succeeded is because he worked hard.

when_to_say: Indicates movement towards the speaker or recovery from a state.
example: 他昏倒后很快就醒过来了。(tā hūndǎo hòu hěn kuài jiù xǐng guòlai le.) - He quickly woke up after fainting.

meaning: to draw a snake and add feet (to ruin by adding something superfluous)
when_to_say: Used when someone adds unnecessary details, ruining something perfect.
example: 你的建议很好，但再改动就画蛇添足了。(nǐ de jiànyì hěn hǎo, dàn zài gǎidòng jiù huàshétiānzú le.) - Your suggestion is good, but any more changes would be drawing a snake and adding feet.

meaning: to stand by a stump waiting for a hare (to wait idly for opportunities)
when_to_say: Used to criticize someone who relies on luck instead of effort.
example: 他总是守株待兔，从不主动争取机会。(tā zǒngshì shǒuzhūdàitù, cóng bù zhǔdòng zhēngqǔ jīhuì.) - He always waits idly for opportunities, never actively seeking them.

meaning: to mend the fold after the sheep are lost (to take action after suffering a loss)
when_to_say: Used to describe fixing a problem after damage has occurred, implying it's better late than never.
example: 虽然损失已经造成，但亡羊补牢为时不晚。(suīrán sǔnshī yǐjīng zàochéng, dàn wángyángbǔláo wéishíbùwǎn.) - Although the loss has already occurred, it's not too late to mend the fold after the sheep are lost.

meaning: to contradict oneself (lit. 'spear and shield contradict each other')
when_to_say: Used when someone's statements or actions are inconsistent.
example: 他的话前后自相矛盾。(tā de huà qiánhòu zìxiāngmáodùn.) - His statements contradict each other.

meaning: a frog in a well (a person with a limited outlook)
when_to_say: Used to describe someone who has a narrow perspective.
example: 他只知道自己村里的事，真是井底之蛙。(tā zhī zhīdào zìjǐ cūnlǐ de shì, zhēnshi jǐngdǐzhīwā.) - He only knows about things in his own village, truly a frog in a well.

meaning: to draw cakes to satisfy hunger (to feed on illusions)
when_to_say: Used to describe someone who relies on empty promises or unrealistic plans.
example: 空谈无用，画饼充饥解决不了问题。(kōngtán wúyòng, huàbǐngchōngjī jiějué bù liǎo wèntí.) - Empty talk is useless, drawing cakes to satisfy hunger won't solve the problem.

meaning: to play the yu (a wind instrument) to make up the number (to fill a position without having the necessary qualifications)
when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is unqualified but fills a position.
example: 他只是滥竽充数，对工作毫无贡献。(tā zhǐshì lànyúchōngshù, duì gōngzuò háowú gòngxiàn.) - He's just there to make up the numbers, contributing nothing to the work.

meaning: to carve a mark on a boat to find a lost sword (to stick to old ways)
when_to_say: Used to criticize someone who is inflexible or adheres to outdated methods.
example: 时代变了，我们不能刻舟求剑。(shídài biàn le, wǒmen bù néng kèzhōuqíujiàn.) - Times have changed, we cannot stick to old ways.

meaning: to play the lute to a cow (to cast pearls before swine)
when_to_say: Used when explaining something profound to someone who cannot understand or appreciate it.
example: 跟他说这些道理简直是对牛弹琴。(gēn tā shuō zhèxiē dàolǐ jiǎnzhí shì duìniútánqín.) - Explaining these principles to him is simply casting pearls before swine.

meaning: the fox assuming the tiger's might (to bully others by flaunting one's powerful connections)
when_to_say: Used to describe someone who uses another's power to intimidate.
example: 他仗着老板的势力狐假虎威。(tā zhàngzhe lǎobǎn de shìlì hújiǎhǔwēi.) - He bullies others by flaunting the boss's power.

when_to_say: Used to express high regard for someone.
example: 我们应该尊敬老人。(wǒmen yīnggāi zūnjìng lǎorén.) - We should respect the elderly.

when_to_say: Describes a person who does not boast.
example: 他是一个非常谦虚的人。(tā shì yī ge fēicháng qiānxū de rén.) - He is a very modest person.

when_to_say: Describes good manners or a polite person.
example: 说话要有礼貌。(shuōhuà yào yǒu lǐmào.) - One should speak politely.

meaning: polite/modest (often used when refusing a compliment)
when_to_say: Used to describe politeness, sometimes implying being overly polite or formal.
example: 你太客气了。(nǐ tài kèqi le.) - You are too polite.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the customs, arts, social institutions, and achievements of a nation, people, or group.
example: 中国文化博大精深。(Zhōngguó wénhuà bódàjīngshēn.) - Chinese culture is broad and profound.

when_to_say: Used to refer to long-established customs or beliefs.
example: 春节是中国的重要传统节日。(chūnjié shì Zhōngguó de zhòngyào chuántǒng jiérì.) - Spring Festival is an important traditional Chinese holiday.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a customary practice or habit.
example: 每个地方都有不同的习俗。(měi ge dìfang dōu yǒu bù tóng de xísú.) - Every place has different customs.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a person's or society's principles or standards of behavior.
example: 他们的价值观不同。(tāmen de jiàzhíguān bù tóng.) - Their values are different.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a community of people living together.
example: 我们生活在一个多元化的社会。(wǒmen shēnghuó zài yī ge duōyuánhuà de shèhuì.) - We live in a diverse society.

when_to_say: Used to describe growth or progress.
example: 经济发展很快。(jīngjì fāzhǎn hěn kuài.) - The economy is developing rapidly.

when_to_say: Used to express likelihood or estimation.
example: 他大概不会来了。(tā dàgài bú huì lái le.) - He probably won't come.

when_to_say: Used to express a polite concern or a reluctant guess.
example: 恐怕不行。(kǒngpà bù xíng.) - I'm afraid not.

when_to_say: Used to express surprise or disbelief at an outcome.
example: 他竟然赢了比赛！(tā jìngrán yíng le bǐsài!) - He actually won the competition!

when_to_say: Used when something desired or expected happens after a long time.
example: 我们终于完成了任务。(wǒmen zhōngyú wánchéng le rènwu.) - We finally completed the task.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the original situation or intention.
example: 我本来想去，但是太忙了。(wǒ běnlái xiǎng qù, dànshì tài máng le.) - I originally wanted to go, but I was too busy.

when_to_say: Used to emphasize a fundamental truth or reason.
example: 他毕竟是新手，犯错是难免的。(tā bìjìng shì xīnshǒu, fàncuò shì nánmiǎn de.) - After all, he's a beginner, so making mistakes is unavoidable.

when_to_say: Used to highlight a specific item or aspect.
example: 我喜欢水果，尤其是苹果。(wǒ xǐhuān shuǐguǒ, yóuqí shì píngguǒ.) - I like fruit, especially apples.

when_to_say: Used to express an unexpected or opposite outcome.
example: 他非但没有生气，反而笑了。(tā fēidàn méiyǒu shēngqì, fǎn'ér xiào le.) - Not only did he not get angry, he laughed instead.

when_to_say: Used to express surprise or disbelief at an outcome.
example: 他竟然赢了比赛！(tā jìngrán yíng le bǐsài!) - He actually won the competition!

when_to_say: Used to emphasize a statement, often with exaggeration.
example: 这简直是浪费时间。(zhè jiǎnzhí shì làngfèi shíjiān.) - This is simply a waste of time.

when_to_say: Used to ask about quantity.
example: 你有多少钱？(nǐ yǒu duōshao qián?) - How much money do you have?

when_to_say: Used to ask about location.
example: 你住在哪里？(nǐ zhù zài nǎlǐ?) - Where do you live?

when_to_say: Used to ask about a person.
example: 他是谁？(tā shì shéi?) - Who is he?

when_to_say: Used to ask about something.
example: 你叫什么名字？(nǐ jiào shénme míngzi?) - What is your name?

when_to_say: Used to ask for a reason.
example: 你为什么不开心？(nǐ wèishénme bù kāixīn?) - Why are you unhappy?

when_to_say: Used to ask about method or reason.
example: 这个字怎么写？(zhè ge zì zěnme xiě?) - How do you write this character?

when_to_say: Used to ask for opinion or suggestion.
example: 这个电影怎么样？(zhè ge diànyǐng zěnmeyàng?) - How is this movie?

when_to_say: Used to ask about a specific choice from a group.
example: 你是哪国人？(nǐ shì nǎ guó rén?) - Which country are you from?

when_to_say: Used to ask about a small quantity (usually under 10).
example: 你家有几口人？(nǐ jiā yǒu jǐ kǒu rén?) - How many people are in your family?

when_to_say: Used to ask about a specific time.
example: 你什么时候回家？(nǐ shénme shíhou huí jiā?) - When are you going home?
